definition:
A fixed point $x^*$ is [*Lyapunov stable*]{} if trajectories of nearby
points $x$ remain close for future time. More formally the fixed point
$x^*$ is Lyapunov stable, if for any $\epsilon>0$, there is a $\delta>0$
such that for all $t\ge 0$ and for all $x \neq x^*$ it is verified
$$\begin{aligned}
d(x^*,x)<\delta \Rightarrow d(x^*,x(t))<\epsilon.\end{aligned}$$ In
particular, $d(x^*,x(0))=0$.
